title: 109_hr1355
content: The "Child Predator Act of 2005" is the short title of this Act. It includes amendments to the Jacob Wetterling Crimes Against Children and Sexually Violent Offender Registration Program. The "Child Predator Act of 2005" includes amendments to the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 regarding criminal offenses against minor victims, such as kidnapping, false imprisonment, sexual conduct, and solicitation. The "Child Predator Act of 2005" amends the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 to include various sexual offenses against minors, such as production of child pornography, solicitation for prostitution, and other wrongful conduct designated by the Attorney General. The "Child Predator Act of 2005" expands the definition of a child predator to include individuals convicted of sexual offenses against minors aged 13 or younger. It also imposes special registration requirements for child predators, including reporting a change of address within 10 days. The "Child Predator Act of 2005" requires child predators to report a change of address within 10 days. State procedures also mandate notifying schools, public housing, and media outlets in the predator's community. The "Child Predator Act of 2005" mandates child predators to report address changes within 10 days. Law enforcement must supervise and verify compliance, with penalties for non-compliance including imprisonment or fines. The Attorney General interprets "community" broadly, giving deference to state interpretations. The "Child Predator Act of 2005" requires child predators to report address changes promptly, with penalties including imprisonment or fines. The FBI is mandated to disclose information on child predators, including recent photographs, on a public internet site. The "Child Predator Act of 2005" mandates the disclosure of registration information of child predators within a specified radius of an address on a public internet site. The site must also have searching and sorting capabilities and display information on child predators clearly.
